author: rtoky8
title: COINLAND
description: Many african countries suffer from malnutrition and food insufficiency because +50% of cultivable land are unexploited

assessments.note: This proposal falls within the scope of the challenge because it addresses a concrete and recognized problem in Africa. However, the solution of tokenization of the usufruct, which would provide funding, does not seem to me to correspond to the problem of uncultivated arable land as I understood it in my reading. Overall, the percentage of landowners in Africa with formal certification of their land title, either individually or jointly, is very low. Completing the idea with a solution allowing progress in land identification and the formalization of land ownership in Africa would make it a proposal more in line with the problem.
It is not clear how exactly this proposal it going to benefit cardano or the people in the african countrys.
Draft proposal. The description of the problem and solution are reasonable, but the absence of a plan and goals makes impact assessment impossible.

This proposal is aligned with the challenge, and the idea seems good. Although, the proposal lacks information about how this would be implemented, what mechanics it would use, a roadmap, dates, therefore more information in general. As it is its just an idea, should be worked into a proper proposal.

The proposal is very relevant, because it intends to work with, in my view, the biggest problem present in the African continent: hunger. If it were possible to improve this situation, and at the same time use token technology, promoting the activities of the Cardano community, how much the continent and our community would benefit, and the objectives of the challenge would be supported.

While the problem statement and solution do provide some glimpse into the idea of the proposal and  have the potential to result in an interesting plan, that could benefit both the African people and the Cardano ecosystem, the fact that the project description is missing entirely lead me to suggest a re-submission for a future fund.

The proposer does not provide a description, a development plan or any other element enabling to evaluate the feasibility of the idea. 
The requested budget is not detailed and seems high to me compared to the project, but maybedue to this lack of details of the steps of development. 
The principle of tokenization of an asset is a known principle that does not seem to me to present any particular risk.
The proposal consists of two sentences and a request for USD100,000. There is no plan. It is not likely to succeed
Given there are only 2 sentences in this proposal it is not likely it is going to be a succes. And for 100k funding there should be more information here.
Draft proposal. There is no plan in the description. I recommend including a detailed plan as per the Catalyst documentation so that we can give you appropriate feedback.

The proposal lacks information about its implementation and how the idea will become a product or platform. There alleged experience also is good but not sufficient to implement the idea since it would be needed some other different background such as blockchain devs and legal. More information should be included in order to properly assess the proposal's feasibility.

The author claims to have more than 15 years of experience as a professor in the financial industry, which is positive, given that the Cardano system is mostly a project of economics and technology. However, we do not know if the author is already familiar with Africa or even with blockchain systems. We also do not have a more detailed explanation regarding your professional journey. It would be beneficial to include some content in this regard, for example, a profile on linkedin. In addition, there is no apparent intention to form a team here, as this project would certainly need professionals from various fields. That is, the information about who would carry out the idea is, unfortunately, superficial.

The self describing 15+ years of experience in financial industries are not backed-up by any external, verifiable links. The project description field is missing entirely, therefore there are no details (budget, plan etc) that could be assessed.

The project is very insufficiently described, it is not possible to assess the stages of development and the criteria for success.
The possible obstacles and risks that the project should be investigated and exposed in future proposals at later stages.
There is not detail on how tokenisation of uncultivated land would occur. There is no plan given thus it is not a feasible project.
Like mentioned above it is not possible to properly asses this proposal. Please add more information and re-submit this for the next fund.
Draft proposal. There is no plan or any information allowing  auditability.

There is no information in this proposal to make it auditable. Important points are missing, such as: roadmap, milestones, budget breakdown, KPIs, key metrics, and delivery dates. As it is, it's not possible to evaluate its auditability.

In theory, this project is great. However, in practice, we have no information on how it would materialize. There is no action plan included, neither an explanation of how the financing money would be used, nor a forecast of the results to be achieved according to the measurement of time. The project is much, much more comprehensive. There are 50% of the unexplored areas. It is a lot of ground to be worked on. It is not said how these tokens would be generated, by what platform this project would be guided ... In summary, we have no content to be analyzed in this part, unfortunately.

As mentioned above, the detailed plan field is missing entirely, meaning that this proposal does not have any detailed, budget, any relevant experience links, any metrics and so on. An interesting proposition, I suggest re-submission for a future fund with all the required information added.

solution: Tokenize the usufruct of these unexploited cultivable land so that they could be exploited for agri business purposes
experience: +15 years of prof. experience in financial industries
